flavor: Evolving a Better You.
printed_text: Each player needs 1 fewer agenda point to win the game.
stripped_printed_text: Each player needs 1 fewer agenda point to win the game.

flavor: Perfecting the Imperfect.
printed_text: Whenever you and the Runner reveal secretly spent credits, gain 1[credit].
stripped_printed_text: Whenever you and the Runner reveal secretly spent credits, gain 1 credit.

printed_text: When your turn begins, you may place 1 advancement token on a card if the Runner did not make a successful run during his or her last turn.
stripped_printed_text: When your turn begins, you may place 1 advancement token on a card if the Runner did not make a successful run during his or her last turn.

printed_text: When you score this agenda, place 3 agenda counters on it. Hosted agenda counter: Do 1 net damage. Use this ability only during a run and only once per run.
stripped_printed_text: When you score this agenda, place 3 agenda counters on it. Hosted agenda counter: Do 1 net damage. Use this ability only during a run and only once per run.

flavor: "You won't feel it. Or anything else, for that matter."
printed_text: Lower the advancement requirement of each Medical Breakthrough by 1. This ability is active even while Medical Breakthrough is in the Runner's score area.
stripped_printed_text: Lower the advancement requirement of each Medical Breakthrough by 1. This ability is active even while Medical Breakthrough is in the Runner's score area.

printed_text:
When you score Philotic Entanglement, do 1 net damage for each agenda in the Runner's score area.
Limit 1 Philotic Entanglement per deck.
stripped_printed_text: When you score Philotic Entanglement, do 1 net damage for each agenda in the Runner's score area. Limit 1 Philotic Entanglement per deck.

printed_text: When the Runner accesses The Future Perfect, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, prevent The Future Perfect from being stolen. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses The Future Perfect while it is installed.
stripped_printed_text: When the Runner accesses The Future Perfect, you and the Runner secretly spend 0 credits, 1 credit, or 2 credits. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, prevent The Future Perfect from being stolen. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses The Future Perfect while it is installed.

printed_text:
The Runner's maximum hand size is reduced by 2.
If Chairman Hiro is trashed while being accessed, add him to the Runner's score area as an agenda worth 2 agenda points.
stripped_printed_text: The Runner's maximum hand size is reduced by 2. If Chairman Hiro is trashed while being accessed, add him to the Runner's score area as an agenda worth 2 agenda points.

flavor: The whitewashed walls dropped away and a beautiful zen garden appeared. It was all an illusion, but it was a comforting illusion.
printed_text:
Gain 1[credit] when your turn begins.
The Runner's maximum hand size is increased by 1.
stripped_printed_text: Gain 1 credit when your turn begins. The Runner's maximum hand size is increased by 1.

printed_text: If the Runner exposes or accesses Psychic Field while installed, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, do 1 net damage for each card in the Runner's grip.
stripped_printed_text: If the Runner exposes or accesses Psychic Field while installed, you and the Runner secretly spend 0 credits, 1 credit, or 2 credits. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, do 1 net damage for each card in the Runner's grip.

printed_text: When the Runner accesses Shi.Kyū, you may pay X[credit]. The Runner must take either X net damage or add Shi.Kyū to his or her score area as an agenda worth -1 agenda point. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Shi.Kyū from R&D.
stripped_printed_text: When the Runner accesses Shi.Kyu, you may pay X credits. The Runner must take either X net damage or add Shi.Kyu to his or her score area as an agenda worth -1 agenda point. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Shi.Kyu from R&D.

flavor: The Tenma clones became Jinteki's third highest-grossing line ever due to the rapid urban expansion that occurred after the war. Their unparalleled reaction times, safety records, and punctuality have made them the top choice for shipping and transportation services.
printed_text: [click]: Swap 2 pieces of installed ice.
stripped_printed_text: click: Swap 2 pieces of installed ice.

printed_text:
Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn.
You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, he or she chooses to suffer 1 brain damage or take 1 tag.
stripped_printed_text: Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn. You and the Runner secretly spend 0 credits, 1 credit, or 2 credits. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, he or she chooses to suffer 1 brain damage or take 1 tag.

flavor: "Together we have all but eradicated natural diseases from the face of this planet. The new spectre of synthetic disease-of bioterrorism-demands that we continue our efforts."
printed_text: Gain 8[credit]. The Runner gains 3[credit].
stripped_printed_text: Gain 8 credits. The Runner gains 3 credits.

printed_text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Install 1 asset, agenda, or upgrade from HQ in the root of a new server. Place 3 advancement counters on that card. You cannot score or rez that card until your next turn begins.
stripped_printed_text: As an additional cost to play this operation, spend click. Install 1 asset, agenda, or upgrade from HQ in the root of a new server. Place 3 advancement counters on that card. You cannot score or rez that card until your next turn begins.

flavor: Trapped in their own reality, a paralyzed runner cannot even jack out.
printed_text:
[subroutine] The Runner cannot break any subroutines on the next piece of ice he or she encounters during this run.
[subroutine] The Runner cannot jack out until after encountering the next piece of ice during this run.
stripped_printed_text: Subroutine The Runner cannot break any subroutines on the next piece of ice he or she encounters during this run. Subroutine The Runner cannot jack out until after encountering the next piece of ice during this run.

printed_text: When the Runner encounters Komainu, it gains "[subroutine] Do 1 net damage." for each card in the Runner's grip for the remainder of this run.
stripped_printed_text: When the Runner encounters Komainu, it gains "Subroutine Do 1 net damage." for each card in the Runner's grip for the remainder of this run.

flavor: Yip Yip!
printed_text:
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage unless the Runner pays 1[credit].
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage unless the Runner pays 1[credit].
stripped_printed_text: Subroutine Do 1 net damage unless the Runner pays 1 credit. Subroutine Do 1 net damage unless the Runner pays 1 credit.

flavor: When locked in a fortress in your own mind, be careful what door you open.
printed_text:
[subroutine] Look at the top 3 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.
[subroutine] You may pay 1[credit]. If you do not, the Runner breaches R&D. They cannot access cards in the root of R&D during that breach.
stripped_printed_text: Subroutine Look at the top 3 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order. Subroutine You may pay 1 credit. If you do not, the Runner breaches R&D. They cannot access cards in the root of R&D during that breach.

flavor: Certain areas of cyberspace are dominated by a single digital entity. Runners call them 'gods', and only a miracle can save those foolish enough to enter their domain.
printed_text: [subroutine] If the attacked server is not Archives, the Runner moves to the outermost position of Archives instead of passing this ice. The Runner cannot jack out this run until after they encounter a piece of ice.
stripped_printed_text: Subroutine If the attacked server is not Archives, the Runner moves to the outermost position of Archives instead of passing this ice. The Runner cannot jack out this run until after they encounter a piece of ice.

flavor: It is difficult to go to Japan without ending up in the sprawl of NeoTokyo.
printed_text: The first time each turn an advancement counter is placed on a card in the root of this server, gain 1[credit]. Limit 1 region per server.
stripped_printed_text: The first time each turn an advancement counter is placed on a card in the root of this server, gain 1 credit. Limit 1 region per server.

flavor: Known as the Red Woman, Hanzō is notorious for her ruthless methods of server protection.
printed_text:
[interrupt] → The first time you would do 1 or more net damage during each run on this server, instead you may pay 2[credit] to do 1 brain damage.
<errata>Errata from CR 1.4</errata>
stripped_printed_text: Interrupt -> The first time you would do 1 or more net damage during each run on this server, instead you may pay 2 credits to do 1 brain damage. Errata from CR 1.4

printed_text:
Plan B can be advanced.
If the Runner accesses Plan B, you may reveal and score an agenda from HQ with an advancement requirement equal to or less than the number of advancement tokens on Plan B.
stripped_printed_text: Plan B can be advanced. If the Runner accesses Plan B, you may reveal and score an agenda from HQ with an advancement requirement equal to or less than the number of advancement tokens on Plan B.

flavor: Out of the corner of his vision, a flash of light. He felt a thud as his grip on cyberspace loosened. Spider didn't like this. He should have bypassed the outer layer of ice by jacking in from the internal server. Another thud, and his whole frame shook with the resounding shockwave. He desperately reached for his shuriken…
printed_text:
Guard cannot be bypassed.
[subroutine] End the run.
stripped_printed_text: Guard cannot be bypassed. Subroutine End the run.

flavor: The annual review of ice as published by the NSCA consistently gives top marks to the ice that provide the most impact in relation to their size and upkeep cost. Critics of the NSCA point to the bounce ratio as the most important stat when judging ice.
printed_text: [subroutine] End the run.
stripped_printed_text: Subroutine End the run.

flavor: YucaBean has seen astounding growth in even the most remote markets.
printed_text: Gain 1[credit] for each remote server with a card in its root.
stripped_printed_text: Gain 1 credit for each remote server with a card in its root.

flavor: The longer the employees didn't look at the Doomsday Clock, the more it gnawed at the back of their minds. A quick look only reinforced what they already knew: there wasn't enough time.
printed_text: Search R&D for an agenda, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
stripped_printed_text: Search R&D for an agenda, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.

flavor: "Truth is a fickle mistress."
printed_text: When your turn begins, gain 2[credit] if the Corp has more scored agenda points than you.
stripped_printed_text: When your turn begins, gain 2 credits if the Corp has more scored agenda points than you.

flavor: "Try to keep up."
printed_text: The first time each turn you play a run event, gain 1[credit].
stripped_printed_text: The first time each turn you play a run event, gain 1 credit.

flavor: "Don't waste my time."
printed_text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, you may expose 1 card.
stripped_printed_text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, you may expose 1 card.

flavor: A job is only as strong as the weakest link. Thankfully Ms. Jones is always on time.
printed_text: Gain 1[credit] for each installed connection resource.
stripped_printed_text: Gain 1 credit for each installed connection resource.

flavor: Tenma clones are excellent at multitasking, their brains custom-made for parallel processing.
printed_text:
Play only as your first click.
Gain [click]. Run any server.
<errata>Errata from CR 1.4</errata>
stripped_printed_text: Play only as your first click. Gain click. Run any server. Errata from CR 1.4

flavor: The clone was surprised to see the red-jacketed man. It was like looking in a mirror, only the mirror made him look…cool. Confident. Individual.
printed_text: Look at the top 4 cards of your stack and add 1 of those cards to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
stripped_printed_text: Look at the top 4 cards of your stack and add 1 of those cards to your grip. Shuffle your stack.

flavor: Stirling entered the server, passing a growling piece of ice. He was unarmed…or so it seemed.
printed_text: Run HQ. The first 2 times this run you encounter a piece of ice, bypass that ice. If successful, you cannot breach HQ.
stripped_printed_text: Run HQ. The first 2 times this run you encounter a piece of ice, bypass that ice. If successful, you cannot breach HQ.

flavor: "I work by referral only, with an up-front fee. The fee is reasonable if you value results." -Silhouette
printed_text: Run HQ. If successful, access 2 additional cards when you breach HQ.
stripped_printed_text: Run HQ. If successful, access 2 additional cards when you breach HQ.

printed_text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click]. Search your stack for a run event and play that run event (paying its play cost), ignoring any additional costs. Shuffle your stack.
stripped_printed_text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend click. Search your stack for a run event and play that run event (paying its play cost), ignoring any additional costs. Shuffle your stack.

printed_text: +1[mu] Your maximum hand size is increased by 1. Whenever the Corp scores an agenda, you may search your stack for a card and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack. Limit 1 console per player.
stripped_printed_text: +1 mu Your maximum hand size is increased by 1. Whenever the Corp scores an agenda, you may search your stack for a card and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack. Limit 1 console per player.

flavor: Express loved libraries. The consoles were weak, but the security even weaker. He wirelessly loaded up his personal blend of code and started cloning the drive. In just a few minutes, another zombie would claw its way to the surface of cyberspace.
printed_text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to play run events.
stripped_printed_text: 1 recurring credit Use this credit to play run events.

printed_text: Use this hardware only if you have made a successful run on HQ this turn. [click][click]: Trash 1 rezzed bioroid, clone, executive, or sysop in the root of a remote server.
stripped_printed_text: Use this hardware only if you have made a successful run on HQ this turn. click click: Trash 1 rezzed bioroid, clone, executive, or sysop in the root of a remote server.

flavor: The grass looked greener on the other side of the tear. But it always did, and there was always another tear.
printed_text: [click]: Draw 1 card from the bottom of your stack.
stripped_printed_text: click: Draw 1 card from the bottom of your stack.

flavor: Appearances are easy to change in cyberspace, but a high-quality render is not easy to mimic.
printed_text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +3 strength. This program cannot interface with ice protecting a remote server.
stripped_printed_text: Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 sentry subroutine. 2 credits: +3 strength. This program cannot interface with ice protecting a remote server.

printed_text: Interface → 2[credit]: Break up to 3 barrier subroutines. 2[credit]: +4 strength. This program cannot interface with ice protecting a remote server.
stripped_printed_text: Interface -> 2 credits: Break up to 3 barrier subroutines. 2 credits: +4 strength. This program cannot interface with ice protecting a remote server.

flavor: The digital equivalent of a fly on the wall.
printed_text:
Install only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Whenever the Corp draws a card, you may pay 2[credit] to reveal that card.
stripped_printed_text: Install only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn. Whenever the Corp draws a card, you may pay 2 credits to reveal that card.

flavor: Catch me if you can!
printed_text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 tracer subroutine. 2[credit]: +3 strength.
stripped_printed_text: Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 tracer subroutine. 2 credits: +3 strength.

flavor: If speed is of the essence, an indirect encounter with a piece of ice is usually best.
printed_text: [trash]: Break all but 1 subroutine on a piece of ice.
stripped_printed_text: trash: Break all but 1 subroutine on a piece of ice.

flavor: Nothing is secure when you have the right documentation.
printed_text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 code gate subroutine. 2[credit]: +2 strength. This program cannot interface with ice protecting a remote server.
stripped_printed_text: Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 code gate subroutine. 2 credits: +2 strength. This program cannot interface with ice protecting a remote server.

printed_text: Secretly spend any number of credits. The Corp guesses if you spent an even or odd amount. Reveal spent credits. If the Corp guessed incorrectly, gain credits equal to twice the amount spent.
stripped_printed_text: Secretly spend any number of credits. The Corp guesses if you spent an even or odd amount. Reveal spent credits. If the Corp guessed incorrectly, gain credits equal to twice the amount spent.

flavor: She was as good as Mr. Li said. The source machine had been compromised in under 24 hours. If a freelance operative could do that, the server clearly wasn't ready to endure Gagarin's legion of corp-owned runners.
printed_text: When your turn begins, you may choose a server. The first time this turn you make a successful run on that server, instead of breaching it, gain 2[credit].
stripped_printed_text: When your turn begins, you may choose a server. The first time this turn you make a successful run on that server, instead of breaching it, gain 2 credits.

flavor: "Why is a raven like a typing desk?"
printed_text:
When you install Theophilius Bagbiter, lose all credits in your credit pool.
Your maximum hand size is equal to the number of credits in your credit pool.
stripped_printed_text: When you install Theophilius Bagbiter, lose all credits in your credit pool. Your maximum hand size is equal to the number of credits in your credit pool.

flavor:
She slipped back onto her hopper. "I'm your family now, so don't twist me, dǒng ma?"
He flicked the e-cig away from his mouth, and nodded. What had he gotten himself into?
printed_text:
You cannot use Tri-maf Contact more than once per turn.
[click]: Gain 2[credit].
When Tri-maf Contact is trashed, suffer 3 meat damage.
stripped_printed_text: You cannot use Tri-maf Contact more than once per turn. click: Gain 2 credits. When Tri-maf Contact is trashed, suffer 3 meat damage.

flavor: "Welcome to the mass install wizard! This wizard will guide you through the process of installing a whole mess of programs onto your almost-certainly inadequate rig. When you're ready to continue, say-oops, too late, here we go!"
printed_text: Install up to 3 programs from your grip (paying the install costs).
stripped_printed_text: Install up to 3 programs from your grip (paying the install costs).

flavor: One of the core problems of quantum computing is isolating the system from external factors to prevent decoherence. The Q-Coherence Chip is one, imperfect, solution.
printed_text:
+1[mu]
When an installed program is trashed, trash this hardware.
stripped_printed_text: +1 mu When an installed program is trashed, trash this hardware.

printed_text: When you install this program, place 1 power counter on it for each unused MU. (Place counters after this program's MU cost applies.) Interface → Hosted power counter: Break 1 subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
stripped_printed_text: When you install this program, place 1 power counter on it for each unused MU. (Place counters after this program's MU cost applies.) Interface -> Hosted power counter: Break 1 subroutine. 1 credit: +1 strength.

flavor: "The best place to hide is in plain sight, don't you think?"
printed_text:
You cannot use Oracle May more than once per turn.
[click]: Name a card type. Reveal the top card of your stack. If the revealed card is of the named type, draw it and gain 2[credit]. Otherwise, trash it.
stripped_printed_text: You cannot use Oracle May more than once per turn. click: Name a card type. Reveal the top card of your stack. If the revealed card is of the named type, draw it and gain 2 credits. Otherwise, trash it.

flavor: You can find Donut in the park on Thursday afternoons, playing backgammon. You want his attention, the price is always the same: a cup of coffee and a donut. That buys you a seat at the backgammon table, and you have until he beats you to talk business and set the price.
printed_text: The play cost of operations and events is increased by 1.
stripped_printed_text: The play cost of operations and events is increased by 1.
